alert.note: Alert for Ingham (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 11:09AM EST until February 19 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Rapids MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Sycamore Creek At Holt affecting Ingham County. Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County. Buck Creek at Grandville affecting Kent County. .Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain fell overnight across the area. In addition, much of the snow on the ground has rapidly melted, adding to the amount of water reaching the rivers and streams. Several small and medium-sized rivers have risen out of their banks and are into minor flood levels. For the Sycamore Creek...including Holt...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Maple River...including Maple Rapids...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Buck Creek...including Grandville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sycamore Creek At Holt. * WHEN...From this morning to late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of low lying areas adjacent to the river, in the Lansing Municipal Golf Course and sections of East Mt. Hope Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Thursday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM EST Thursday was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.3 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.2 feet on 12/31/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr. The next statement will be issued Friday morning, or earlier if conditions warrant.
